intro: Rapunculus verus, commonly known as the meadow bell, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are bright yellow with four petals and are borne in clusters at the top of the stems. The plant is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, and it blooms from late spring to early summer.
